description.p: I've been working on a wrapper that turns binary streams into emitters.

I wanted something I could use in place of socket.io on the Pine project. Because this project will need to be able to send events quickly from browser to node process to node process to browser, I needed something that would not need to parse and rewrite each event. I also wanted to use binary WebSockets because it seemed that they would be faster (and they have proven to be quite fast so far).

This is the first post on this blog. I mostly made this blog as a main website to direct people to so they can find me, but I'm also interested in writing about some of my open source exploits. I built the site and blogging engine behind it from scratch, so it will probably have a few problems as I continue to work on it. I like the idea of putting an unfinished site out there, pushing one to work on it; here it is.
